I'm happy, your birthday brings a pardoning 


I woke you up that day, and it was your birthday.

We drove to see our grandma that day, and she gave us a toy from the Cheerios cereal box. And it was your birthday.

We drove 179 miles to the place I now reside and it was your birthday.

We got our stomachs mad at us, and needed something quick. We ate at Wendy's, though it was your birthday.

We loitered, and it was your birthday.

We went out for dessert, and ate ourselves into aching because it was your birthday.

We took photographs, so we wouldn't forget it was your birthday.

We drove downtown, and you saw things for the first time--things you hadn't noticed nor ever seen before. The air was perfect, the streets loud, the lights brisk, sharp with color, and it was your birthday.

We walked down the train track shaking the can of paint, and it was your birthday. 

We cowered under the bridge, and sprayed color-- a symbol of ourselves and then some latin on the columns, and it was your birthday.

We heard you say you didn't like it anymore and that you were uncomfortble and that this was it, you were leaving. You walked down the tracks alone and it was your  birthday.

We walked down the tracks into the living quarters, and soon it wasn't your birthday anymore.

in my mouth and to a pen:
  Today all of the negative spite and justice seeking and ugliness in me boiled over and I wrote. I am charmed by it's ugliness--the whimsy of it gives me satisfaction. And what a raw confession! I can hardly believe I have courage to share something so personal publically, but isn't that is what this journal is all about? LIVEjournal? For me, I think it is, as I ponder what is it's purpose, and hope the following tickles you...Note that the title got it's name not because it is about SHel SIlverstein, but because it is written in a nonsensical format that he pioneered...

 SHEL SILVERSTEIN'S VENGEANCE

It occured to me the other day
while imagining what
a soiled heart for to repay.
It occured to me to appear at your home
while imagining that
it was to there I venture to roam.
Upstairs to crawl into where you sleep
while imagining pat-pat
no noise, hardly a peep!
You return there, see me, and fill with joy
while imagining sat
only it occurs to you with me is another boy.
and we sit as soil on your bed.
while imagining dat
Oh the ways this will fertilze the mess in your head!
It occured to me thais was the best thing I could do
while imagining at 
to take the soil that stained my innards and give them back to you.

The images pass by inconcise, but fathomable.
     "You know what worries me, mom?"  "What is th--" I interrupted her before her inquiry was finished.
     "Who ever visits the shoemaker? I mean, outside of needing a shoe fixed? Who would pay a visit to his decrepid body for the  need of companionship?" 
          Who? Who will visit?
      Who? To whom have you paid a visit? To an old friend? a new one? a distant one? distant relative? the gas station man? the donut maker? the fast food ladY? the banker? the man living in the basement of your building? have you paid a visit to apathy? (you bastard) to lies? to intellect? to athletics? to science? to gourmet?
       How about your conscious? have you visited? How about your subconscious? Have they visited each other lately? If they have, did you wake up? Have you awoke lately?

If you are reading this, that certainly means I've been thinking of you. I've been thinking of you, and i've gained courage in doing so to share with you other things that percolate (sp?) through my system.
    Flattery has come in hoardes these days--or is it simply in my mental framework to have the confidence to recieve a compliment? A lot of it has come concerning a few personality attributes, but mostly how I look. I am indeed flattered, though surprised by constant reminders that they think my appearance  well...Let me tell you something about how I look:
        I have a pair of jnco jeans (old favorites) from the seventh grade that I still occasionally wear. My swimsuit I've had since tenth grade. My orange sneakers since the eleventh. If I should wear "capri" style pants, they go right to my ankles as almost perfect fit pants. When I wear stalkings, I must wear garters to hold them up because: a) they are too long and I have to fold them over and attach them to the garter to prevent sliding off or 
b) I must wear children's size and stretch them so that the garter can hold them up. At my job, to fill the coolers, cook the food, or clean  the yogurt machine I must work on my tiptoes. At work the other day we cleaned the ice cream display case out and they all chuckled with amusement as they stuffed me inside to clean the bottoom of it that no one else could reach. They close the lid and you can imagine me looking like a zoo animal there! The other trick they play is that they have me crawl in the cupboard under the cash register. They ask someone to go retrieve paper from under the register and "BOOO!" there is my face! ha. The girls usually scream, and I delight in the surprise. AT the grocery store I'm forced to  be a shelf climber for items on the top shelf. Keeps it adventuresome. I am not so small, but not so large I suppose either. Was it being born premature that did it? I am much like my Grandma Mimi in many ways, so I cannot help but wonder if I will dissintegrate to the same little midget that she is.
       While on the subject of myself, she types embarrrassedly, I have noticed this quirk about myself: when i delight in something, I BITE MY LOWER LIP AND GRIN AT THE SAME TIME. It seems to me I've been biting a lot lately in the past few weeks...heh. So let me tell you of it: 
            That night, the debut of a part of me--a lot of me, really--it was true and it meant so much that you all were there. I remember the commaraderie and you were actually proud in the good way and I was of you. I remember the meal and the TV put the Temptations on and we all danced as they sang! We danced indeed.  Or at least a couple of us. the next day, too, just one delight after another. I don't recall being so content in so long. Did I tell you that the tears snuck out of my eyes because I was so  happy? 
      And she came into my room, nose sniffling, wiping her eyes because she is weary of war and uncertainty. She says she must be careful about who she tells this to, she doesn't want to sway what a person has already established in her life. But I'm grateful I could be there for it. I didn't do anything to help, I don't think--or was it that I said too much? And he wrote this, and this is what made her cry:
           "Who God is...My heart is wrestless tonight. I will have trouble sleeping--far more trouble than normal.
                 Tomorrow morning, I will wake up.
              God is the peace between the dusk and the dawn--I may often sleep through it and fail to remember it...I may have nightmares in his presence--i may wake up with sweat on my pillow and i may have trouble finding God when i do--God as a healing silence when i rest--but I will find it.
              God is much like sleep...for some, God comes easy. For some, God is routine. For me--sleep and God--it has never been either.
            I FIND BOTH when I am far too WEARY to fight them off anymore."
    She is weary of seeking. Has she found Him? So tired of that question is she.
            I looked a little bit on my own. yes. 
      And one of the most marvelous days soon followed. Eighty degrees and we are in the backyard of a rennovated boarding house on Park Ave and i am spending most of the afternoon with dear friends and some of my most favorite musicians of all time. (mewithoutyou) The rabbit was on his leash and the food was almmost all dumpstered--marvelous fresh produce and all kinds of pasta! Great desert and the chicken  grilled and everything else homemade. They put us on the guest list and the show was enjoyed certainly. They are humans, just like us, though I think them heros. The week passes and I see certain ones of you struggle, I see your struggle and I try to understand it. Surely i feel it, if I can say. I also see you content. And TA-Da! many things are provided, and I knew You could do it, I was just dwelling in the uncertainty of how.  And then I went to that show and I waited outside in the cold wind but they let me in at the last moment and it was worthwhile (iron and wine) to hear you croon your melodies that way. After that I went to the Fallout and she met me there and we scored real good in our dumpster diving adventure. We decided then that we could call our band Anorexic Chicken. We especially like the huge bag of fortune cookies nad when I got home I had a bowl of fortune cookie cereal...I think our favorite part, however, was the dumpster full of bread dough. We jumped on it, into it and it was surreal--like walking on clouds of marshmallow!  yesternight was swell too with the application at Como Zoo--which i will probably work there!, the surprise birthday and the popper that was the best gift and the game and commarderie. You all make me laugh. Then back to the homefront where we held a ceremony for the official end of a crush for a roommate. IT WAS CLEVER !  We lit candles, made a list of why it is good it's gone, did a therapy excercise, heard a song, saw a reenactment, signed the card, always you accept yourself, and then ate kudos bars--kudos to Lauren for her being over it! I loved it. I served as the chorus and chanted "woe is Lauren" at the appropriate times...heh. A good chat with Gentry BOeckel and we will wear the anti-homophobia stickers on our backpacks at Bible school tomorrow. visiting with the others, a good read, and sleep...
      c'est la vie (such is life).

I admire people who are things I could never be. I admire them profusely for that reason. This is where the opposite sex comes in.  I admire men to the point of almost wanting to be one--though this is a hyper-exaggeration, and awkward to admit. I admire men, but not in way that makes me a thought-tramp, a lust maven, but rather, in a way that you distance yourself from your heroes, because you want to step back and adore...I hope the distinction is very clear.

 I don't know if it is the weather, I don't know if it be my body's natural tendancies, but longing is far from absent, and I understand more clearly what I want and need than I ever have before. So much pends on timing, you should know, and---

 there is a boy and though he hasn't said it, I know he likes me. I can see where we have a lot in common, and I  appreciate who he is, but I just...I don't know. He told me I looked 'tremendously beautiful' at the play, and who would refute such uncommon flattery? (or at least it is uncommon for me!) It being uncommon is what motivates me to consider him. I mean to say that it is uncommon, to my knowledge, to be liked by someone. It is even more uncommon for me to like someone and actually be liked back. But how ridiculous to like someone simply because they like you so well! That is a huge element, but it cannot be the only one. I just can't evoke the way he wants me to feel for him out of me, nor am I in the business of breaking hearts. Do I tell him that life is wretchedly busy right now and it's not a good idea for me to be 'involved'? That is a fallacy, to a certain degree. I cannot be dishonest. Do I risk ruining him by telling him I don't 'feel' the same way, but I value his friendship? That sounds like such a line. I  don't know what to do, but I am begining to understand these:

                             I am severely intrigued by boys who lock themselves in rooms--soundproof ones--and make music with their eyes closed on an instrument of choice--piano, guitar, bass. Young men who retreat away to isolation with sound  intrigue me to the point of longing. Somtimes they have a friend with them--even a certain young lady--but still I remain intrigued.

                            I am severely intrigued by boys who drive mopeds and grin about it. Perhaps it is an influence of the Amelie film, but somthing in me yearns to be tossed on the back of a moped with an unknown destination other than the company of our own selves. That we would whimsically take off and have no obligation to return, no sense of time...Young men with the quiet approcach of a moped and a sense of adventure intrigue me to the point of longing. Let us clarify: moped, not motorcycle.

And might I add a man who smokes a corn cob pipe? Yes, I would love to be around it. Or any pipe, really--that is, other than a hooka. I've no sensation of being near that, it actually repels me. But the smell of pipe tobacco, certainly...and oh, if even he grew it himself! yes, right next to the eggplant and the cilantro that I'm growing in the garden to eat for our supper, where after we will go for a walk while he smokes his corn cob pipe, and I wearing my favorite dress, and then we will cruise on the moped for a while and then we will have a bonfire and eat our dessert from it and--snaP! like a record stopped abruptly, what am i doing here sharing this fantasy? er--sorry...

A line from the show I directed: Would my dreams recognize me if they saw me? Would they come to me and say, 'She is the one who imagined us?'

                    I remain here daydreaming (of isolated music and mopeds), I have not given up. They--the daydreams-- are a remedy to the longing, I will admit. I have learned that it is possible for reality and daydreams to mesh; personally, many of my daydreams have been superceded by real experiences, and these are not flavorless, wimpy daydreams!  However, I cannot help but wonder if I have outdone myself here...does such a young man exist? and if he does, is it even probable he might find me charming? Is it? Do you? Do you ride mopeds, retreat to music, and grin at my presence? *sigh*

            I will admit, I think I've shared too much already, so I hope you are glad I welcomed you in...

I also have been thinking, though it's a bit too...umm...exclusive, perhaps...that the song "Brand NEw Colony" by the Postal Service is one of the best love songs of all time. I've been expressing myself via sound lately. Sound without words. Noises. Which would make a journal entry null. Or, I would have to have a microphone for you to hear my expressions. Nonetheless, this one has been percolating (sp?) in there for a while, and I--well,...   
     
     Let me tell you, by the end of our time together here you will be sick of me. You will be sick of the way I try to help you, even when you don't need it. Always I will offer to do this or that, or defend this or that, or listen to you tell of this or that. Consistently I will offer and sometimes you will need it, and sometimes not. It is the consistency, however, that surprises you. No one else you've known is so eager to offer. You will grow weary of my interest, my offerings, my need to be of some aide to you on any level. I hope against it, but truth is it may simply tire you out.

               Your heart is no match for my love.

     You probably don't believe me, but by the time our time together has expired, you will be glad for it. You will be weary of my inquiries. You will grow old of my intuitions about you. Some you will agree with. Some intuitions you will claim that I am totally off the mark about you. Other intuitions--and these are my favorite--will surprise you, as an exposed secret. You never expected me to know things about you that no one else does. Some of them I will share with you, others I will keep to myself, for I hold these intuitions sacred. You are most surprised that anyone would want to know your secrets. To me,this is the crux of why we are friends, and you are startled that my want to know your secrets is unmatched. It makes you uncomfortable and you will be sick of me.

                 Your heart is no match for my love.

     By the time we've had time here, you will be ready to be done with me. You will be tired of the coating I've slowly dripped on your life. You won't believe the way I've gotten to know you. You will be so stuffed with the benevolence and good will I've tried to achieve with you by enticing your secrets to be shared. THE TRUTH IS that I've[HE] has done everything for you and you don't know what to do with it. No, no you will not be satisfied with all that you have received, for you have received so much of it that your soul will have collapsed. I've been telling everyone lately that Conan O'Brian was my first crush. 

 ANd I love telling it, though it is not the truth. I do not truly remember a first crush. I remember that in the sixth grade, I had a dream I saw Anthony Sterler naked. I had a hard time talking to him the next day, even though he sat next to me in class--I felt dirty. I didn't even really like him, not that I recall. Anthony Sterler moved to Texas soon thereafter. Anthony Sterler's name wasn't really Anthony Sterler; it was Anthony Enema, and his family had the name changed and that is the truth. I remember that one day in the sixth grade I got a note on yellow paper from the red-haired boy named Joe Wilson. It was a simple note, nad it said that he had liked me since kindergarten. Unbelieveable. I think he is married now to the only other black haired girl who was in our class. heh.

 And I remember that night, only weeks ago--though it seems a long while when you yearn for something--and we could see the endless sky and smell the endless citrus. I crawled in the bag, zipping heat, and she was saying something profound to me huddled around her flashlight, sandwiched between it and her sleeping bag. The bag was the sealant on our souls and the the flashlight it's guide and the moment like the delights of eternity itself. Though the dew soaked us in that moment, it was the best to leave the tarp off to invite the atmosphere of trees, citrus, truth, and twinkle...I love those days, as if being with a lover...a creator...better than my daydreams are such tangibles...
  and i want to write more of into the forest after the citrus, but alas. I shudder into exhaustion, and hope none of it goes forgotten and petition to God for the continuation of a severed independence...

and i will tell you, if the morrow comes, that my first crush was Conan O'brian. :)
